summary:
Here is a summary of the key points from the MD&A report:

Revenues & Profits 
- Revenues for 2020 were $958.4 million, down 3.3% compared to 2019 due to lower volumes resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic. Net income increased from $67.7 million in 2019 to $89.5 million in 2020 due to higher income from operations and lower interest expense.

Segment Performance
- Insurance revenues declined slightly but profit margins improved. Healthcare revenues grew driven by new wins while margins expanded significantly. Emerging Business revenues fell due to lower volumes but margins held steady. Analytics revenues rose marginally with higher margins.

Expenses & Costs
- Cost of revenues fell due to declines in employee, travel and infrastructure costs stemming from COVID-19. Gross margin improved from 33.9% to 34.9%. SG&A costs dropped 12% thanks to cost reduction initiatives. 

Cash Flows & Liquidity
- Operating cash flows rose on higher cash earnings and working capital improvements. Cash from operations funded capital expenditures of $42.2 million. The company drew down $100 million from its credit facility in March 2020 as a precautionary measure but repaid it in April 2020. Total debt declined to $227 million.

Outlook
- COVID-19 caused revenue declines and delivery disruptions in 2020 but digital delivery capabilities proved resilient. Cost actions provided some offset. The outlook remains uncertain depending on the pandemic's ongoing impact.
